item.title: Recognizing and honoring the restoration and renovation of the Bishop Museum's historic Hawaiian Hall, the Nation's premier showcase for Hawaiian culture and history, on the occasion of the Museum's 120th anniversary.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (text: CR S8618)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(text: CR S8618)
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S8618)
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S8618)

Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6849)

summary.text:
Recognizes the reopening of historic Hawaiian Hall of the Bishop Museum in Honolulu, Hawai'i, on the 120th anniversary of the founding of the Museum.

Honors and praises the Bishop Museum for its work in ensuring the preservation, study, education, and appreciation of Native Hawaiian culture and history.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Recognizes the reopening of historic Hawaiian Hall of the Bishop Museum in Honolulu, Hawai'i, on the 120th anniversary of the founding of the Museum.

Honors and praises the Bishop Museum for its work in ensuring the preservation, study, education, and appreciation of Native Hawaiian culture and history.

bill.title: A resolution recognizing Bishop Museum, the Nation's premier showcase for Hawaiian culture and history, on the occasions of its 120th anniversary and the restoration and renovation of its Historic Hall.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
